reviews.text:
The restaurant has a very great location and I don't understand how it can be spoiled with such service. After a walk in the forest, my friend and I decided to go in and try the first course. Despite the fact that about 30% of the tables were occupied, we waited a long time for the waiter. They were all standing at the bar. They paid attention to us only when I started actively waving the menu. So, we ordered fish soup and green borscht. We were warned that we should wait 20 minutes. We were surprised that it was so long, but we thought, well, maybe they are so cool that they cook right away, instead of reheating. After 40 minutes, BARELY WARM meals were brought to us. When I asked why we waited 40 minutes and they couldn't even heat it up properly, they said that the kitchen was overloaded. But, I'm sorry, what? There are no people. We asked to heat up the dishes better, and to bring salt and pepper, and brown bread. It's been 20 minutes of waiting for bread. The dishes got cold again.
By the way, we also took the menu ourselves. The photo shows the number of people in the cafe, because of which we had to wait so long
P.S. We were complimented by the establishment for the wait, but after we asked for it ourselves

Beautiful interior and... that's it! We sat down at a table at 17:26, and at 17:55 we started looking for a waiter. The waiter took the order, warning that the waiting time would be from 15 to 20 minutes. At 18:30 we approached the waiter to remind us about the blankets that we asked for, since it was cool. The waiter replied that he had not yet registered our order. After waiting for the food we ordered, we saw the following: Carbonara pasta for 3+, pizza 4 meats and Hawaiian... no words, my husband and I even joked that this was pizza from Silpo (although Silpo is tastier). The highlight was a Long Island cocktail (vodka with Pepsi and lemon, and the Pepsi was passion fruit flavored) and a salad with shrimp and avocado without avocado!

Everything is simple, but modern. A cafe with large summer terraces, located in the forest, plenty of seats, you can even organize a banquet. There is a stationary toilet; children are given a children's menu with pencils to distract them from waiting. There are many fresh flowers along the perimeter of the tables, umbrellas are decorated with light bulbs. The food is not fancy, but quite tasty. During the long wait for pizza, the children were treated to ice cream.

I had to come here to wait for my friend. I ordered coffee with lactose-free milk. Apparently, slops taste better. There is no worse coffee anywhere. Disgusting, without foam, diluted, and it took 10 minutes to prepare. The waiter was very surprised when I informed him that their coffee was terrible. However, in view of the rest of the reviews, where negative reviews of this drink appeared repeatedly, they could change everything, and not just be surprised every time. I will never come back here, because if the coffee is so messed up, then what can be said about the other dishes and drinks?

Apart from the pleasant location, there are no advantages at all. The food is disgusting. In the salad with “veal” there was some kind of meat that could not be differentiated, it looked like soy. How you can manage to cook shish kebab so tastelessly is a complete mystery.
“Service” deserves special attention. The waiters are slovenly children dressed in dirty clothes and have no idea about their job. They don't know the menu. We asked for tea without jasmine - they brought it with jasmine. Hot dishes were served first, then salads were brought. I ordered a glass of lemonade and they brought me a liter. I ordered bread - they didn’t bring it at all.
The doors to the utility rooms are wide open and guests have the opportunity to admire the trash going on there.
Behind the establishment there are, without exaggeration, some kind of rubbish, benches and a table at which the staff hang out, smoke, etc.
Blankets are piled up like some kind of garbage, and in the same place there are some mops and brooms.
It’s amazing that in the corner at the table there is a man sitting at a table, watching everything and trying to “build” these unfortunate children into a decent looking man, who is clearly in charge. And he is clearly far from the restaurant business if he does not see all this fierce trash happening around him.
In a word, this is the level of a cheap tavern, and not a restaurant, as this establishment unreasonably positions itself.
With this approach, this mischief will be covered very quickly.
I came in a couple of weeks after the first impression - zero reaction.
Guys, it shouldn’t be like this - garbage and washed dishes and unwashed dishes - all together!…
